intro: Echinospermum sinaicum, commonly known as the Sinai echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs. Echinospermum sinaicum is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. It is also known for its potential use in traditional medicine.
